result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joel L Phelps was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $1000.00 has been applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Firearm that was confiscated during the incident may be released to the third party, Daniel Achterberg.

timeConds.notes: with Huber and Good Time Credit.

9:33 am cases called. 15CF62, 15TR866, 15TR867, 15TR868, & 15TR869. Defendant Joel L Phelps in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader regarding agreement reached. Amended complaint addressed. Attorney Edelstein confirms receipt, waives formal reading. Preliminary hearing waived. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Edelstein confirms receipt and waives formal reading. Defendant enters pleas to Counts 1 & 2.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 on the amended complaint. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 3 & 15TR866, 15TR867, & 15TR868. Court vacates refusal in 15TR869. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Edelstein. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS-COUNT 1 Only-6 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 3 days served. To begin today. $2000 fine inclusive of costs, plus $42.50 Blood Draw Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 34 month DL revocation. 24 mo IID commencing today. OWI Assessment. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. Firearm to be released to a third party-Daniel Achterberg. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Court orders bond on file to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-01-2015 09:30 am
Ex No 5 - Letter from Holly Ford, Court Reporter, Dated 5/19/2015
Ex No 4 - 1995CF000113 - Winnebago Co Judgment of Coviction
Ex No 3 - 1995CF000113 Winnebago Co Court Minutes
Ex No 2 - Plea Questionnaire Form

Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:15 pm

Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Joel L Phelps in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA - Challenge still exists as to OWI 3 case in Winnebago CO in 1995.  The Court:  Finds a prima facie case supporting a collateral attack.  State calls Defendant adversely.  Def sworn in for testimony.  Court will allow Def being called adversely by the State.  Direct Exam by DA.  Court addresses nature of potential judicial conflict related to 93CT-101.  Colloquy undertaken with Def.  Def and counsel waive any potential conflict by Judge Dutcher and request matter go forward.  Testimony continues.  DA requests Court take judicial note of certified record obtained as to Waushara Co Case No 93CT-101.  The Court will receive for purposes of this hearing, the record from Waushara Co Case No. 93CT-101 - authenticated and therefore admissible.  Marked as Ex No 1 - Entered and Received.  Cross Exam by Atty Edelstein.  Ex No 2 Marked - Plea QN Form - Entered and Received.  Ex Nos 3, 4 and 5 marked.  Entered and Received.  Re-Direct by DA.  Re-Cross by Atty Edelstein.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty Edelstein.  The Court:  Finds that the absence of the WInnebago Co record is not dispositive of the motion.  Def derived a benefit from previous representation would indicate that there was a knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel.  Request to set aside the 1995 Winnebago Co conviction which evolves from 95CT-113.  State has successfully rebutted that collateral attack based upon the evidence.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:02 p.m. Defendant Joel L Phelps in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be privately retaining counsel.
